item.title: Dominic Cummings launches attack on Boris Johnson's integrity
item.description: Boris Johnson's one-time closest ally makes a string of explosive allegations about the PM's conduct.

item.title: India Covid crisis: Inside the Delhi hospital running low on beds and oxygen
item.description: Covid-19 patients who get a hospital bed are being described as the lucky ones in India's deadly second wave.

item.title: India Covid crisis: Hospitals buckle under record surge
item.description: Families of Covid patients are pleading for hospital care as emergency rooms and wards overflow.

item.title: US lifts pause on Johnson & Johnson vaccine
item.description: The officials said it was important for women be told about the potential risks of the jab.

item.title: Indonesia submarine search feared to have failed as oxygen runs out
item.description: Attempts by Indonesia to rescue 53 crew seem in vain as their oxygen supply is thought to have run out.

item.title: Covid: 'Smell training' recommended for lost sense of smell
item.description: About one in five people say they still cannot smell properly eight weeks after a Covid infection.

item.title: Covid-19: Israel records no daily deaths for the first time in 10 months
item.description: The drop in deaths is seen as a promising sign as Israel vaccinates more than 50% of its population.

item.title: Myanmar: Military chief set to make first foreign trip since coup
item.description: The Jakarta regional summit will be Min Aung Hlaing's first trip since the army took power in a coup.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell makes first US court appearance
item.description: The socialite is accused of helping Jeffrey Epstein groom and sexually abuse underage girls.

item.title: Brexit: UK and Australia agree 'vast majority' of trade deal
item.description: A full trade agreement in principle should be agreed between the UK and Australia by June

item.title: French police station stabbing: Terror inquiry into Rambouillet knife attack
item.description: Anti-terror prosecutors are leading the inquiry after the unarmed employee was stabbed in the neck.

item.title: European Super League: Chelsea 'deeply regret' involvement in competition
item.description: Owner Roman Abramovich and the Chelsea board say they 'deeply regret' the decision to join the controversial European Super League.

item.title: Boy stabbed to death in Newham, east London
item.description: The teenager was confirmed dead at the scene and officers are trying to find and tell his family.

item.title: The Papers: Cummings' 'war' with PM and 'No masks by summer'
item.description: Saturday's front pages focus on former No 10 adviser Dominic Cummings' attack on the prime minister.

item.title: Two 13-year-old boys desperate to get a vaccine
item.description: Vaccines are currently unlicensed for the under-16s and it's up to individual doctors to decide.

item.title: George Floyd: Black Lives Matter protesters react to Chauvin conviction
item.description: Two young women who demonstrated after George Floyd's death react to Derek Chauvin's conviction.

item.title: Iceland volcano eruption: Music video and wedding filmed at Fagradalsfjall
item.description: How an Icelandic band and a marriage ceremony made the most of spectacular scenes at Fagradalsfjall.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The challenges of training in a Covid pandemic
item.description: Athletes tell us what it's like training for the world's biggest sporting event during a pandemic.

item.title: Week in pictures: 17 - 23 April 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Greta Thunberg becomes 'bunny hugger' on Twitter
item.description: Climate activist updates her social media biography following Boris Johnson comments at climate summit.

item.title: Bristol bear with a sore tooth gets dental work done
item.description: Neo, four, needed treatment after keepers found he had an abscess at the base of one of his teeth.

item.title: Hollywood has its most diverse year, says report
item.description: The number of ethnic minorities involved in watching or making US films increased in 2020.

item.title: It's the Oscars 2021 - but how many people have seen the main films?
item.description: This year's Academy Awards take place on Sunday, with a largely low-key crop of contenders.

item.title: Mental health: Trauma, genocide and my invisible illness
item.description: The BBC's Victoria Uwonkunda fled Rwanda in 1994 but it took time to recognise the impact it had on her.

item.title: Telegram misogyny: 'They wanted to tie me and my child to a horse'
item.description: Abuse victims claim Telegram's moderators need to do more to tackle misogyny and other forms of hate.

item.title: Gregory's Girl: 'The affection for it overwhelms me'
item.description: The teenage romantic comedy set in a Scottish new town has been an enduring success for 40 years.

item.title: Palestinian election: Leaders face reckoning as rare vote looms
item.description: After years without polls, the Palestinian political landscape may be about to change dramatically.

item.title: Working abroad: 'The pandemic just made it harder'
item.description: With global travel restrictions, Covid has had a huge impact on the lives of those working abroad.

item.title: Post office scandal: 'The first thing I did was cry'
item.description: Ex-postmasters describe their joy at their convictions being quashed after a long fight for justice.

item.title: Covid: Science advisers call for better PPE for healthcare workers
item.description: Doctors say it's a "crack of light" after more than a year of campaigning for improved equipment.

item.title: Covid-19: India arrivals begin UK hotel quarantine
item.description: Some UK nationals say they are struggling to secure flights home as India sees a surge in Covid.

item.title: Covid: Care staff reveal mental impact of pandemic
item.description: Care staff explain how the pandemic has affected their mental health as a union calls for them to get more support.

item.title: Lobbying row: Why ministers have two mobile phones
item.description: Critics say ministerial messaging desperately needs regulation - but not everyone agrees.

item.title: Leno own goal hands Everton win at Arsenal as Gunners fans protest
item.description: Everton boss Carlo Ancelotti says "we are back" as a howler from Arsenal's Bernd Leno gifts his side a crucial win in their bid for the top four.

item.title: McGill holds off O'Sullivan comeback to knock out defending champion
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan's hopes of a record-equalling seventh Crucible title end with a second-round final-frame loss to Anthony McGill.

item.title: Wales manager Giggs charged with assaulting two women
item.description: The Wales manager denies three offences after an incident in Salford in November.

item.title: Second-placed Exeter end leaders Bristol's winning run
item.description: Defending champions Exeter Chiefs put on a determined display to win at Premiership leaders Bristol.

item.title: Women's Six Nations final: Cleall on being hailed world's best & running squad's tuck shop
item.description: Poppy Cleall has put in some talismanic performances for England in the Women's Six Nations, but arguably her most innovative contribution has been off the field.

item.title: Woods posts first picture since car crash
item.description: Tiger Woods posts a photo of himself smiling on a golf course - the first time he has been pictured since he was seriously injured in a car accident.

item.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan: Champion loses to Anthony McGill in World Snooker Championship thriller
item.description: Watch highlights of the deciding frame as champion Ronnie O'Sullivan's hopes of a record-equalling seventh world title end in round two as Anthony McGill triumphs 13-12.

item.title: Which countries are on the red list and what are the quarantine rules?
item.description: India has now been added to the UK Government's Covid "red list" of countries.

item.title: Covid: India on UK travel red list as Covid crisis grows
item.description: The rule change effectively bans travel amid soaring infection rates and a rapidly rising death toll.

item.title: India Covid crisis: Did election rallies help spread virus?
item.description: Did campaigning for state elections in India help coronavirus to spread?

item.title: Covid: Restaurants and pubs are reopening, but what are the rules?
item.description: Pubs, cafes and restaurants will reopen in Wales and Scotland on Monday 26 April.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: A nightmare on repeat - India is running out of oxygen again
item.description: Facing a rising wave of coronavirus, and record case numbers, India finds itself battling for breath.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: The number of people allowed to meet in Wales is changing - and you can now get a haircut in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People 45 or over in England are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 33 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on transport?
item.description: As UK coronavirus restrictions continue to be relaxed, public transport could become much busier.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: What is a Covid passport and what are the UK's plans?
item.description: The government is considering how people could prove they are unlikely to transmit Covid.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Covid: Which areas are being mass tested for variants?
item.description: People who live, work or travel through two south London boroughs are being urged to take a Covid-19 test.

item.title: Is the Australia-NZ travel bubble the way ahead?
item.description: Australia and New Zealand have quarantine-free travel, but will other countries follow their lead?

item.title: Covid: When can I go on holiday abroad or in the UK?
item.description: A traffic light system ranking foreign countries by coronavirus risk is to be introduced - the rules on UK holidays are also easing.

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: Covid: When will children return to school and what are the rules?
item.description: Children are returning to school across the UK, after months of enforced home-schooling.

item.title: Coniston Beatrix Potter farm welcomes 'rare' triplet lambs
item.description: It is only the third time in 18 years that a ewe at Yew Tree farm has given birth to three young.

item.title: Deer graze on east London housing estate
item.description: Surprised residents wake up to find a herd of deer grazing on their doorstep.

item.title: Inside the chemist's made entirely out of felt
item.description: After wowing art lovers in the US and China, Lucy Sparrow's latest felt fantasy is her first UK show in five years.

item.title: Litter: The Merthyr Tydfil teenager fighting the fly-tippers
item.description: Daniel Lewis was so frustrated with fly-tippers, he started cleaning his home town's streets himself.

item.title: Girl, 6, donates 'lifetime of hair' to cancer charity
item.description: Six-year-old Amelia Barratt donates her locks and more than £800 to help children with cancer.
